name: eleventy-njk
description: Snippets, Syntax Highlighting, Hover, and Formatting for njk

njk.formatting.description: Whether to enable/disable Twig PrettyDiff formatting.

njk.braceLine.description: If true an empty line will be inserted after opening curly braces and before closing curly braces.

njk.bracePadding.description: Inserts a space after the start of a container and before the end of the container if the contents of that container are not indented; such as: conditions, function arguments, and escaped sequences of template strings.

njk.braceStyle.description: Emulates JSBeautify's brace_style option using existing Pretty Diff options.

njk.braces.description: Determines if opening curly braces will exist on the same line as their condition or be forced onto a new line.

njk.commentLine.description: If a blank new line should be forced above comments.

njk.comments.description: This will determine whether comments should always start at position 0 of each line or if comments should be indented according to the code.

njk.compressedCss.description: If CSS should be beautified in a style where the properties and values are minifed for faster reading of selectors.

njk.correct.description: Automatically correct some sloppiness in code.

njk.cssInsertLines.description: Inserts new line characters between every CSS code block.

njk.elseLine.description: If else_line is true then the keyword 'else' is forced onto a new line.

njk.endComma.description: If there should be a trailing comma in arrays and objects. Value multiline only applies to modes beautify and diff.

njk.forceAttribute.description: If all markup attributes should be indented each onto their own line.

njk.forceIndent.description: Will force indentation upon all content and tags without regard for the creation of new text nodes.

njk.formatArray.description: Determines if all array indexes should be indented, never indented, or left to the default.

njk.formatObject.description: Determines if all object keys should be indented, never indented, or left to the default.

njk.functionName.description: If a space should follow a JavaScript function name.

njk.indentStyle.description: Choose to indent using tabs or spaces.

njk.indentLevel.description: How much indentation padding should be applied to beautification? This option is internally used for code that requires switching between libraries.

njk.tabSize.description: 0 will default to the editor's tab size. Stores the number of 'inchar' values to comprise a single indentation.

njk.methodChain.description: When to break consecutively chained methods and properties onto separate lines. A negative value disables this option. A value of 0 ensures method chains are never broken.

njk.neverFlatten.description: If destructured lists in script should never be flattend.

njk.newLine.description: Insert an empty line at the end of output.

njk.noCaseIndent.description: If a case statement should receive the same indentation as the containing switch block.

njk.noLeadZero.description: Whether leading 0s in CSS values immediately preceeding a decimal should be removed or prevented.

njk.objectSort.description: Sorts markup attributes and properties by key name in script and style.

njk.preserve.description: The maximum number of consecutive empty lines to retain.

njk.preserveComment.description: Prevent comment reformatting due to option wrap.

njk.quoteConvert.description: If the quotes of script strings or markup attributes should be converted to single quotes or double quotes.

njk.space.description: Inserts a space following the function keyword for anonymous functions.

njk.spaceClose.description: Markup self-closing tags end will end with ' />' instead of '/>'.

njk.tagMerge.description: Allows immediately adjacement start and end markup tags of the same name to be combined into a single self-closing tag.

njk.tagSort.description: Sort child items of each respective markup parent element.

njk.ternaryLine.description: If ternary operators in JavaScript ? and : should remain on the same line.

njk.unformatted.description: If markup tags should have their insides preserved. This option is only available to markup and does not support child tokens that require a different lexer.

njk.variableList.description: If consecutive JavaScript variables should be merged into a comma separated list or if variables in a list should be separated.

njk.vertical.description: If lists of assignments and properties should be vertically aligned. This option is not used with the markup lexer.

njk.wrap.description: Character width limit before applying word wrap. A 0 value disables this option. A negative value concatenates script strings.
